transcript:
in the center where the men with a flag of truce had passed that morning, the lines were so near together that the men could see one another's faces and speak to one another. Besides the soldiers who formed the picket line on either side, there were many curious onlook- ers who, jesting and laughing, stared at their strange foreign enemies. 
Since early morning despite an injunction not to approach the picket line the officers had been unable to keep sight-seers away. The soldiers forming th
